main event: Ground and radar observation of a round object with four trailing objects over Marion, Indiana.
interesting points: The object appeared to be brighter than the four trailing objects.
The object was observed at an elevation of 60 degrees, disappearing over the horizon in a downward motion.
There was a B-58 aircraft in the pattern for landing to the southwest, which may have extended into the vicinity of Marion, Indiana.
The sighting lasted for around 7 minutes.
The report includes photographs taken by a photographer from Marion, Indiana.
sighted object: round object with four trailing objects
witnesses: State Policeman James Bradley, Deputy Sheriff Joe Johns, and Lt. Lowell Calhound
